result.execSummary:
The defendant Laura A Hurst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution to be determined.
*PER HEARING RESTITUTION FOR WALMART WAS DETERMINED and Converted to a Civil Judgment.
In lieu of payment of court costs and DNA surcharge, Court gives credit for 13 days time served.  Costs and surcharge are deemed paid in full.

Straight Time.
Apply 81 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.

ADDRESS INFO for Laura A Hurst
Current: 101 Larkspur Ln, Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 06-02-2015)
Prior: 717 Wisconsin Ave, C/O Racine County Jail, Racine, WI 53403 United States
Wal-Mart restitution request forms (3) and screen shot of video surveillance

Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court.   Defendant Laura A Hurst did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tried calling number provided for videoconference but no one was in room.  Attorney Fragoso states he will proceed without Defendant.  Ms. Dahl-Merriweather appears on behalf of Wal-Mart.  State states they are seeking $938.68 in restitution.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding restitution amount being requested. Attorney Fragoso questions Ms. Dahl-Merriweather.  Court sets restitution in the amount of $750.00.  Amended Judgment of Conviction needed.

ADDRESS INFO for Laura A Hurst
Current: 717 Wisconsin Ave, C/O Racine County Jail, Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 05-06-2015)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Restitution hearing on May 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
2 read-in lists

Defendant Laura A Hurst in court, in custody, with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information and 2 read-in lists.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  State requests restitution to Wal-Mart but requests a restitution hearing.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding sentencing.  Court sets restitution hearing.  Defendant to appear by videoconference, if possible.  Attorney Fragoso to notify the court of Defendant's custody status (where Defendant is housed at).  If Defendant is incarcerated at a facility that cannot accomodate videoconference, Defendant waives her appearance for restitution hearing.   Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME (CREDIT - 81 days)     -  TIME SERVED  -       

RESTITUTION:  to be determined  *Restitution hearing date set*

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (court gives credit for time served (13 days) and considers these costs/surcharges paid)

  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Laura A Hurst in court, in custody, with Attorney Sam Benedict for Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Benedict requests a plea and sentence date on behalf of Attorney Fragoso.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on March 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.
